name: Pudina Paratha
history: Pudina Paratha, originating from the Indian subcontinent, is a type of flatbread flavored with mint (pudina). It's a variation of the classic paratha, known for its refreshing taste and aromatic flavor, often served with curries or yogurt.
description: Pudina Paratha is a delicious flatbread made with wheat flour, fresh mint leaves, and a mixture of spices. It's rolled out and cooked on a griddle, often brushed with ghee or butter, resulting in a flaky, flavorful, and aromatic bread.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a bowl, mix the wheat flour, chopped mint leaves, green chili, cumin seeds, ajwain, and salt. Gradually add water and knead into a soft dough. Let it rest for about 15 minutes.

instructions.title: Roll and Cook the Parathas
instructions.description: Divide the dough into equal portions. Roll each portion into a circle using a rolling pin. Heat a griddle or tawa and place the rolled dough on it. Cook until brown spots appear on one side, then flip and cook the other side. Apply ghee or oil to both sides while cooking.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the hot Pudina Parathas with yogurt, pickle, or any curry of your choice.

tips: Ensure the dough is soft and pliable for easy rolling.
Cooking on medium heat is essential to get crispy parathas.
variations: Add grated paneer or mashed potatoes to the dough for a different flavor.
Incorporate other herbs like coriander or spinach for added nutrition.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh but can be stored in an airtight container for up to 24 hours.
storage.instructions: Reheat on a griddle before serving if stored.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a hot griddle or tawa until warm and slightly crispy.
presentationTips: Cut into triangles and serve on a colorful platter.
Accompany with a side of fresh salad for a complete meal.
